meanings.definition: A unit of measurement of the refractive power of a lens.
meanings.sent1: The optometrist measured the lens's strength in diopters.
meanings.sent2: The glasses I bought have a diopter value of -2.5.
meanings.sent3: I tried on glasses with such high diopters that I could see into the future!
meanings.sent4: Her vision was like a camera lens, adjusting its diopters to focus on different distances.
meanings.sent5: The concept of diopters finally clicked for me when I saw the world through corrective lenses.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement of the curvature of a lens or mirror.
meanings.sent1: The telescope's lens had a curvature measured in diopters.
meanings.sent2: The mirror's diopters affected the way light was reflected.
meanings.sent3: The funhouse mirror had such extreme diopters that it made everyone look like aliens!
meanings.sent4: Her smile reflected in the mirror, distorted by the diopters of its surface.
meanings.sent5: The diopters of the lens determined how sharply the image would be focused.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement of the refractive error of the eye.
meanings.sent1: The optician calculated the patient's refractive error in diopters.
meanings.sent2: His prescription indicated a diopter value of +1.75 for his right eye.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her diopters were so high, she could see around corners!
meanings.sent4: The diopters of his eyes were like a compass, guiding him through the blurry world.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained how diopters help correct vision problems by adjusting the focus.
